content:
Create a Send Email Quick Action for Cases

Available in: Lightning Experience, Enterprise, Essentials, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer Editions.

User Permissions Needed:
Manage Cases AND Customize Application (to create and modify the Send Email quick action)
Customize Application (to edit a page layout)

To use the Send Email quick action on the Cases object, you must have Email-to-Case enabled. The Send Email quick action is created by default when you enable Email-to-Case on new orgs.

Create the Send Email quick action:
From Setup, click Object Manager tab.
Select Cases and open Buttons, Links, and Actions setup page.
Click New Action.
For Action Type, select Send Email.
Set up email fields in the order that you want them to appear.
Make a field read-only or required if needed.
Save the field properties.

To ensure emails are associated with Salesforce records:
Create predefined field values for To Recipients, CC Recipients, and BCC Recipients.
Use the formula editor to associate your selected field with a Salesforce record using the JUNCTIONIDLIST function.

Add the quick action to the case page layout so itâ€™s available for agents to use.

title: Configure Send Email Quick Action for Cases in Service Cloud
